definition: to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though

sentences.english: Two hearts once by so near, but are now to so hang up.
sentences.chinese: 兩顆心曾經靠的那麼近，如今卻要就這樣拋卻。

sentences.english: Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up to enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.
sentences.chinese: 歲月悠悠，衰微之及肌膚，熱忱拋卻，頹廢必致靈魂。

sentences.english: If this computer does not work, we should give up.
sentences.chinese: 這臺電腦如不美觀不工作，我們就拋卻它吧。

sentences.english: Battles throws all of its past projects to the wind and embraces the uncertain and glorious future.
sentences.chinese: Battles拋卻過去，去擁抱未知卻燦爛的將來。

sentences.english: Russia but tell yourself and opposed Russian not away.
sentences.chinese: 俄無奈告訴自己，逞強並非是俄拋卻。

sentences.english: You may lean on a railing overlooking, flying mood, complexity and confusion of dust discard Jiuxiao .
sentences.chinese: 你可以憑欄遠眺，放飛心緒，繁雜的紛塵拋卻九霄。

sentences.english: Two in three people have given up their dream of owning a home, research shows.
sentences.chinese: 調查顯示，三分之二的英國人已經拋卻買房胡想。
